modules.description: This module implements a low-level event loop for handling I/O operations on file descriptors and timed events. It supports registering callbacks for readability and writability of file descriptors, scheduling deferred actions, and managing event loop lifecycle. Concrete use cases include building network servers that handle multiple connections concurrently and applications requiring precise timing control.

Implements low-level event loop operations for handling asynchronous I/O and timers. Provides functions for registering file descriptors, managing timer events, and dispatching callbacks when events occur. Works directly with file descriptors, timer structures, and user-defined callback handlers. Useful for building custom event-driven networking or concurrency systems where fine-grained control over event sources is required.

This module provides a minimal event loop for handling I/O and timing events, enabling registration of callbacks for file descriptor readability and writability, as well as scheduling delayed actions. Its core functionality includes managing event sources and dispatching handlers when I/O or timer events occur, with support for custom event-driven systems. The child module extends this by exposing low-level operations for fine-grained control over file descriptors, timers, and callback dispatching. Together, they allow building efficient network servers or system tools that react to asynchronous events with precise control over concurrency and I/O.
